website_summaries.verdict: Generally, the Inov-8 Roclite 325 GTX is a reliable trail running shoe for neutral runners. The breathable Gore-Tex® especially got positive remarks for providing foot protection while running on wet surfaces. Overall, testers wrote that the shoe was able to give a good combination of comfort, durability, flexibility, ankle support, and traction.
pros: The majority of the runners were highly appreciative of the shoe’s comfortable feel
The Gore-Tex® material worked incredibly in keeping the foot dry while running on wet conditions, said some runners
Several users admired the reliable grip of the Inov-8 Roclite 325 GTX, especially on technical terrains
According to a few wearers, the shoe is very flexible
A couple of runners stated that the shoe felt agreeably light
A user mentioned that the shoe required no break-in time
it was comfortable from the moment it was first used
A few purchasers approved of the cleat-cut construction of the shoe, which provided ankle support on uneven surfaces
cons: The shoe’s price was perceived to be slightly expensive
A few wide-footed runners were disappointed by the shoe’s narrow toe-box

website_summaries.verdict: With its versatile grip, the Roclite 325 is fit for fast-packing, mountain running, and trekking. It’s protective upper, built around the natural anatomy of the foot, ensures that runners have a sense of freedom, comfort, and safety while on the trail. Those looking for an adaptable trail running shoe for different outdoor adventures should check this out.
pros: Most reviewers said that the Inov-8 Roclite 325 was comfortable once it was broken in
Several users said that it was supportive yet lightweight for a hiking shoe
A lot of testers appreciated the simplicity of the shoe’s design
Some runners were thankful for the above ankle support provided them
The majority of reviewers mentioned that the shoe worked on any terrain
One user even said that the sole was efficient, even on uneven ground
Plenty of testers said that the upper was sufficiently breathable
cons: A few users said that the Roclite 325 still needed quite some time to break in
One user expressed that the eyelets of his shoe ripped after only six weeks of use

customer_reviews.title: Love these as I have a long standing ankle problem
customer_reviews.text: Love these as I have a long standing ankle problem. Substantial upper and soles, good padding around the ankles. I use them for trail running in the Pennines, occasional damp feet which I think is water getting in the top around the ankle. Fantastic grip on most surfaces except on wet leaves when nothing but spikes would do! I'm size 10 and they are a little bit narrower than the running shoe equivalent as others have remarked but length wise they are fine. The sole is lasting better that my previous roclite282 GTX. Overall I think they are a great all round product and I will be buying these again in 2018.
customer_reviews.author: Dr H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all rounder.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these boots. They are brilliant, being non slip and light in weight. A really good boot for either walking or running over any terrain. They look good on as well. I was advised that the men's boot would be the best one for me as they fit small I understand. This was good advice and they are very comfortable right from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. B. Clifford

customer_reviews.title: Early fault
customer_reviews.text: Great for 1 day - really light, new sole very grippy. Unfortunately one of the lacing loops then pulled out. I've never had this with Inov8 before, so hope this isn't a systemic fault with the updated design. I've bought another pair (from a different retailer - PBS) so fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Good boot so far, read reviews for sizing before ordering.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to take half a size up after reading reviews. Good lightweight and comfortable boot. Delivery was longer than stated but I was reimbursed £10 for the inconvenience, which was a nice gesture.
customer_reviews.author: James McDonald

customer_reviews.title: ... fit was too narrow sadly - inov8 are a great brand but this one wasn't right
customer_reviews.text: Sent back product as the fit was too narrow sadly - inov8 are a great brand but this one wasn't right. refunded no problem.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Fitted like a glove out of the box. I already own another pair of the trainer type so knew to order a size up from my normal fitting.
customer_reviews.author: Evans

customer_reviews.title: GTX seems to make the shoes tighter than expected. ...
customer_reviews.text: GTX seems to make the shoes tighter than expected. Can't comment on weatherproofness just yet. Breathability is ok; shoes will run hot in warm weather but considerably less than other boots.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good but narrow
customer_reviews.text: Trainers seem well made and strong with good support. Unfortunately too narrow as I have wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Garry mc

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Great cushioned alternative to normal walking boots (I don't run).
customer_reviews.author: G. Scruby

customer_reviews.title: Seller makes you pay
customer_reviews.text: Seller makes you pay if too small. This boot cut is not a normal size
customer_reviews.author: Sue Blight

customer_reviews.title: Go up half a size
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 9 for my husband which is his usual size, however I think the shape of the boot makes them come up slightly smaller. He has ordered a 9.5 now and is very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great boot!
customer_reviews.text: I used these for Dale Trail Series 20! A great boot!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan41

product_meta.title: inov-8 Inov8 Roclite 325 Gore-TEX Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Inov8 Roclite 325 GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoes Stay protected no matter what the weather thanks to the GORE-TEX membrane offering breathable and durable protection from the elements. . Inov8 Shoe Fit Scale For technical footwear, a good fit is essential to enhance your performance. Inov8's new Shoe Fit Scale makes it easier to find the perfect fitting shoe. All Inov8 shoes are designed with Met-Cradle technology to lock down the mid-foot for a stable hold, where they differ is in the toe box. The shoes are now graded from 1 to 5, Grade 1 representing their closest, most precise fit and Grade 5 representing the widest fitting toe box. The lower the number on the scale, the narrower the fit, which ensures minimal internal movement of the foot when running fast on technical terrain. Shoes with the higher numbers on the scale will suit athletes with a wider foot and those wanting that extra comfort in the toe box. This wider toe box allows the toes to splay for increased stability when lifting heavy weights. It's also perfect for longer runs and races when toes begin to swell. Inov8 have graded the Roclite 325 GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoes as Grade 3. GORE-TEX Upper Shoes engineered with GORE-TEX Extended Comfort product technology are designed for indoor and outdoor use in moderate and warmer conditions or during higher activity levels. They are durably waterproof combined with optimised breathability and are the ideal solution for people who value outstanding climate comfort and heat release. The Inov8 Roclite 325 Running Shoes are constructed from a flexible nylon mesh upper with mesh inner lining providing all round breathability and key ventilation, keeping your feet cool and dry through every step. Providing stabilisation and security to the upper fabric are super-durable upper materials when combined with an 8mm drop ensures outstanding comfort for you whilst you're out on the run. Built around the natural anatomy of the foot, the new ADAPTERWEB met-c
feature_bullets: GORE-TEX Upper - Offers enhanced breathability as well as providing complete protection from water.
Mesh Lining - For added comfort and breathability.
Adapterweb Met-Cradle - Adapts to the natural movement and swelling of the foot during motion.
X-Lock System - Holds and locks the heel in place to offer increased support and a better fit.
Integrated Tongue Gusset - Keeps all debris at bay and out of the shoe.
